column4: if i try to install mozilla-mplayer then apt-get also install mplayer-386 (I dont want mplayer-386)
then install mplayer-686 or mplayer-k7 first
i did.
it shouldn't do that then
how do you know? have you tried it?
instructions tell me that mplayer-plugin WILL NOT work with 1.0.8
ignore them
u sure? have u tried this?
http://mplayerplug-in.sourceforge.net/install.php#plugin
so I can actually apt-get the mplayerplugin then.. The thing is ..if I do...then it will ALSO get mplayer-386. And i dont want mplayer-386. Is there a way to NOT get mplayer-386?
just the mplayer plugin.
for me, if you get mplayer-686 or mplayer-k7, the 386 version isn't pulled in
hmm.. for me it's a different story. I typed: apt-get install mplayer-mozilla and BAM! it tells me it will install mplayer-386.
you're on breezy, right?
breezy 5.10 i believe.
are you using the apt-get or synaptic?
apt-get BUT if Synaptic can select ONLY mplayer mozilla plugin then by all means.
i was thinking the opposite
hmm right now... it wants to install mplayer-386 no matter what. I compiled mplayer a while ago my own way...and it works perfectly. I dont want ubuntu's compiled mplayer.
btw do u know how to clear apt-get memory of what packages it wants to install ?
oh. i thought you installed one of ubuntu's other compiled mplayer pkgs. you're SOL, then
it seems whenever i type apt-get install anyprogram it wants to isntall other programs like mplayer-386, firefox-dev etc... no relevance to xmms.
sudo apt-get -f remove
